title: Meta-Learning Guided Pruning for Few-Shot Plant Pathology on Edge Devices
summary: This paper addresses the dual challenge of deploying accurate deep learning models for plant disease detection on low-cost edge devices and learning from scarce labeled data in remote agricultural areas. It proposes a Prune-then-Meta-Learn-then-Prune (PMP) pipeline, integrating Disease-Aware Channel Importance Scoring (DACIS), to combine neural network pruning with few-shot learning. This approach achieves a 78% model size reduction while retaining 92.3% of the original accuracy, enabling real-time field diagnosis at 7 frames per second on a Raspberry Pi 4.

title: Mapping the landscape of mathematical models for antimicrobial resistance: a scoping review
summary: This scoping review analyzed 36 mathematical models of antimicrobial resistance (AMR) published between 2019 and 2024, revealing a predominance of deterministic ordinary differential equation (ODE) models focused on bacterial resistance in human hosts. The paper highlights significant methodological limitations, a lack of holistic One Health perspectives, and geographic biases within the current AMR modeling landscape.

title: Predicting Early and Complete Drug Release from Long-Acting Injectables Using Explainable Machine Learning
summary: This paper introduces a novel data transformation and explainable machine learning (ML) approach to predict early and complete drug release from 321 long-acting injectable (LAI) formulations. The method accurately predicts early drug release and classifies release profiles, while also identifying key material characteristics that modulate drug release dynamics using Shapley additive explanations, providing a quantitative strategy for LAI optimization. It outperforms current time-dependent approaches for complex release curve predictions.

title: Prior-Guided DETR for Ultrasound Nodule Detection
summary: This paper introduces a novel Prior-Guided DETR framework for robust ultrasound nodule detection, addressing challenges like irregular shapes, indistinct boundaries, and speckle noise. By progressively incorporating geometric and structural prior knowledge into different network stages, the proposed method significantly enhances detection accuracy for thyroid and breast nodules. It achieved superior performance compared to 18 existing methods, particularly excelling in detecting morphologically complex nodules on multiple clinical and public datasets.

title: Mind the Gap: Continuous Magnification Sampling for Pathology Foundation Models
summary: In histopathology, pathologists examine both tissue architecture at low magnification and fine-grained morphology at high magnification. Yet, the performance of pathology foundation models across magnifications and the effect of magnification sampling during training remain poorly understood. We mod...

title: Toward Global Large Language Models in Medicine
summary: This paper addresses the critical imbalance in medical Large Language Models (LLMs) which are predominantly trained on high-resource languages, thereby limiting global healthcare access and equity. The authors introduce GlobMed, a large multilingual medical dataset spanning 12 languages (including low-resource ones), and GlobMed-Bench, a comprehensive benchmark to evaluate existing LLMs across multilingual medical tasks. To overcome observed disparities, they developed GlobMed-LLMs, a suite of multilingual medical LLMs, demonstrating significant performance improvements, particularly for low-resource languages.

title: Investigating the impact of copper-PEDOT:PSS matrix towards non-enzymatic electrochemical creatinine detection
summary: This paper presents a novel non-enzymatic electrochemical sensor for rapid and accurate creatinine detection using a carbon electrode modified with a copper-PEDOT:PSS matrix. The sensor leverages the formation of specific Cu(I) and Cu(II) creatinine coordination complexes as the detection mechanism, demonstrating high selectivity and long-term stability in artificial urine. This technology promises enhanced point-of-care kidney-function monitoring.

title: Responses of the Neurobiological Craving Signature to smoking versus alternative social rewards predict craving and monthly smoking in adolescents
summary: This study utilized an fMRI-derived Neurobiological Craving Signature (NCS) to examine craving-related brain responses in adolescent experimental smokers versus non-smokers. It found that NCS responses to smoking cues, compared to social rewards, were elevated in experimental smokers and predicted self-reported craving and monthly smoking, with both neural responses and smoking behavior correlating significantly with peer-derived environmental tobacco smoke exposure.

title: Edge-aware GAT-based protein binding site prediction
summary: This paper introduces an Edge-aware Graph Attention Network (Edge-aware GAT) for highly accurate and efficient prediction of protein binding sites across various biomolecules. By constructing atom-level graphs with integrated multidimensional structural and edge features, the model achieves superior prediction accuracy (0.93 ROC-AUC for protein-protein interactions) and interpretability, addressing limitations of traditional methods.
